meanings.definition: A note added to a mathematical proof or philosophical argument.
meanings.sent1: In the math class, the teacher explained the scholium at the end of the equation.
meanings.sent2: The book included a scholium to help readers understand the complex theory.
meanings.sent3: The scholium in the textbook made a joke about the confusing formula.
meanings.sent4: Her explanation was like a scholium, shedding light on the difficult concept.
meanings.sent5: The scholium clarified the theorem, making it easier to comprehend.

meanings.definition: A comment or annotation added to a text.
meanings.sent1: After reading the article, she wrote a scholium in the margins.
meanings.sent2: The editor's scholium provided additional context to the story.
meanings.sent3: His scholium in the book pointed out a funny typo in the text.
meanings.sent4: The author's note acted as a scholium, enhancing the reader's experience.
meanings.sent5: The scholium highlighted an important detail that was easy to miss.

meanings.definition: A brief explanatory statement or observation.
meanings.sent1: The professor's scholium clarified the key points of the lecture.
meanings.sent2: She added a helpful scholium at the end of her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The scholium in the report made a clever analogy to simplify the data.
meanings.sent4: His insightful scholium was like a beacon of understanding in the discussion.
meanings.sent5: The scholium succinctly summarized the main idea of the text.
